items.title: Exercise 1: Integration Memo
items.text:
Internal Memo: Post-Merger Integration (PMI) Update

Following the successful closing of the acquisition of TechFlow Ltd, the administration team is now focused on the integration phase. 

Due Diligence revealed several areas where operational synergies can be achieved, particularly in supply chain management. If we had integrated our procurement systems earlier, we would be seeing these savings already. 

Next week, we will begin the migration of employee records to the central HR portal. It is vital that all department heads provide their local data by Friday EOD to ensure a smooth transition.

questions.question: What phase of the M&A process is the company currently in?
questions.explanation: The memo explicitly states they are 'now focused on the integration phase'.

questions.question: Which sentence uses a mixed conditional to discuss a missed opportunity?
options: If we had integrated our procurement systems earlier, we would be seeing these savings already.
It is vital that all department heads provide their local data.
We will begin the migration of employee records.
questions.explanation: This sentence links a hypothetical past (had integrated) with a present result (would be seeing).

items.prompt: Exercise 2: M&A Terminology. A 'Data Room' (VDR) is used for:
options: Securely sharing confidential documents during due diligence
items.explanation: A virtual data room is a secure repository for sensitive deal documentation.

items.prompt: Exercise 3: Mixed Conditionals. Complete the sentence: 'If they ____ (not / hide) the debt during due diligence, the deal ____ (be) easier to close now.'
items.modelAnswer: If they hadn't hidden the debt during due diligence, the deal would be easier to close now.

items.prompt: Exercise 4: Present State to Past Result. Rewrite: 'The company is very disorganized, so the audit took three weeks.' -> 'If the company ____ (not / be) so disorganized, the audit ____ (not / take) so long.'
items.modelAnswer: If the company weren't so disorganized, the audit wouldn't have taken so long.

items.prompt: Exercise 5: M&A Chunks. To 'acquire a stake in' a company means:
options: To buy a part of the company's ownership
To sell all your products to the company
To build a fence around the company's office
items.explanation: Acquiring a stake means buying shares or a percentage of ownership.
